newsitem.title: USA: RLI Corp enters Hawaiian insurance market.
newsitem.headline: RLI Corp enters Hawaiian insurance market.

text.p: RLI Corp said Tuesday it entered the homeowners insurance market in Hawaii.
The company said its proposal to assume business formerly underwritten by the Hawaii Property Insurance Association won ratification during the association's board meeting last week.
First-year premiums are projected at $10 million to $12 million, RLI said.
Homeowners insurance in Hawaii is subject to "standard" risks associated with personal lines, yet is also exposed to damage caused by wind and lava flow.
